programme.title: BBC News

programme.desc: Conversation, advice and great company to make your morning.

programme.title: Critical Incident S3 (14/15)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S24 (71/80)
programme.desc: Featuring properties in Birmingham, Warrington and Staffordshire.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Today's teams are hunting for treasures at the Oswestry Showground with Natasha Raskin Sharp and experts Ben Cooper and Kate Bliss. Before we see their items go under the hammer, Charles Hanson auctions off a rare Chinese treasure that was discovered in a carrier bag on its way to a charity shop.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Doctors (An Old Friend) S24 (n°38)
programme.desc: «An Old Friend»Daniel gets exciting news from an old friend.

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix S1 (n°4)
programme.desc: Jay and Dom go up against each other building coffee tables out of the most unusual items.

programme.title: Escape to the Country S19 (44/70)
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a couple who want to escape life under the Stansted flight path.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip S24 (19/25)
programme.desc: Irita and Phil are in the north east, where Phil buys a huge Methodist church sign.

programme.title: Bridge of Lies S1
programme.desc: Ross Kemp as a team of four work colleagues - Bob, Andrew, Frank and Fiona - take on the Bridge of Lies. One by one they all face the bridge, choosing who faces each crossing depending on the question category. Each bridge crossing has 32 potential steps - 22 truths and 10 lies - and they must cross by stepping on the truths and avoiding the lies, earning money for each correct answer. Once they have each faced the bridge on their own, those who have been successful will join forces to face the final crossing for a chance to take home the cash.

programme.title: Pointless S27
programme.desc: The quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Richard Osman.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas bring you the stories that matter from across the country.

programme.title: EastEnders (n°6668)
programme.desc: Patrick makes a big announcement to his shocked family.

programme.title: Dragons' Den S20
programme.desc: A wizard-inspired pair believe magical drinks and mini golf can cast a spell over the Dragons, and a nervous entrepreneur pitches an all-natural supplement that promises glowing skin from within. There's a sweet pitch from chocolate makers who've spotted a gap in the market, and a show-stopping demo courtesy of a pole-dancing mum who's turned a school project into a business.

programme.title: The Apprentice S17 (12/12)
programme.desc: The two finalists battle it out one last time to become Lord Sugar's new business partner.

programme.title: The Apprentice You're Hired S17 (12/12)
programme.desc: Tom Allen meets Lord Sugar's new business partner to discuss the most memorable moments of the past 12 weeks. They are joined by former candidates and special guests.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.
